3.title: Crimes sur Internet: Cybermarché du Crime
3.plot: From Paris to San Francisco, Amsterdam and the heart of America, this is a plunge into the obscure Internet, its crime, its economy, its perils, and ultimately, its philosophy.

imdb.plot outline: As crime gradually invades the Internet, more people begin to realise that we are facing a menacing reality that is not at all virtual. In front of a completely new type of crime, the cybercrime, unaware Internet users can easily become prey risking both their physical and mental integrity. Throughout this documentary series, Flavie Flament will introduce us to the new methods used by the cybercriminals, the treacherous new modes of criminality and how to detect the elaborately hidden cybersnares laid by the nefarious online predators. By gathering the testimonies of the victims as well as their loved ones, Flavie will help the viewer to understand how criminality invades our lives through the Internet and achieves its omnipresence in a survey that will revolve around four subjects: cyber harassment, cyber prostitution, cybercrime markets and ultimately, cyber paedophilia.
imdb.title: Crimes sur Internet
plot: As crime gradually invades the Internet, we take a deep plunge into the obscurity of the net to explore its perils and its numerous hidden faces, particularly the most dangerous ones.::Nick Riganas

As crime gradually invades the Internet, more people begin to realise that we are facing a menacing reality that is not at all virtual. In front of a completely new type of crime, the cybercrime, unaware Internet users can easily become prey risking both their physical and mental integrity. Throughout this documentary series, Flavie Flament will introduce us to the new methods used by the cybercriminals, the treacherous new modes of criminality and how to detect the elaborately hidden cybersnares laid by the nefarious online predators. By gathering the testimonies of the victims as well as their loved ones, Flavie will help the viewer to understand how criminality invades our lives through the Internet and achieves its omnipresence in a survey that will revolve around four subjects: cyber harassment, cyber prostitution, cybercrime markets and ultimately, cyber paedophilia.::Nick Riganas
